item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If you delete the method, you will get an error.
The error will be because the method is called somewhere during startup (hence how it makes the prices.txt).
You can remove that too.

The reason this prices.txt is generated, is because in the cache there are item definitions.
These item definitions contain data like wield anims, colors, names, descriptions, All the stuff you use when making custom items in ItemDefs.
Also in the cache with these item definitions, are the item prices.
Yes. The item prices are in the cache files.
And so someones solution to it was to just dump the prices from the cache into a text file, and use it server sided.

So yes, you can remove it if you don’t want it. It won’t harm anything.

Read full topic

I thought to delete this method:
Code: [Select]
public static void dumpPrices() {
try {
//FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(new File(“prices.dat”));
FileWriter fw = new FileWriter(“prices.txt”);
for (int j = 0; j < 12000; j++) {
ItemDef item = ItemDef.forID(j);
fw.write(item.id + " " + item.value + “\r\n”);
}
fw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe) {ioe.printStackTrace();}

}

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay for sprites, you do want to use:

I believe (did not test) the signlink’s findcachedir could be cleaned up a bit:

public static String findcachedir() { File cacheFile = new File(System.getProperty("user.home") + "/ServerName/"); if (!cacheFile.exists()) cacheFile.mkdir(); return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/ServerName/"; }

That really does nothing. There was just code not needed. I’m sure you could make it less. But still.

Everything else looks fine…

If you still get the error, make sure to run it using java (not javaw) so the cmd should print errors.

item.title: Closed
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Go into your user home directory and delete the cache folder you have in there.
The signlink created some null files and your client didn’t check for updates (no idea why). So when trying to load, it tried to load the data from the null files, which has nothing in them, so that caused you to have a connection error.

You can try changing your cache link to this:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/g52e5nshmr2t5l7/cache.zip
Re-compile and then try again.

Sometimes the direct links don’t work properly.

Read full topic
